column2: Symbasileus was a title bestowed upon the oldest sons of Emperors when they were crowned as co-Emperors alongside their Father.
column3: Le despote est le plus haut titre honorifique de l’Empire byzantin, après celui d’empereur. Seuls les proches parents, traditionnellement le fils aîné, peuvent en bénéficier.
column4: Despot ist der höchste Ehrentitel im Byzantinischen Kaiserreich und untersteht nur dem Kaiser. Er kann nur engen Verwandten verliehen werden, traditionell dem ältesten Sohn.
column6: El título honorífico de déspota era el más importante del Imperio Bizantino después del de emperador. Puede otorgarse a los familiares cercanos, tradicionalmente al hijo mayor.

column2: After singing the ancient hymns and performing the correct rituals and ceremonies, we have presented [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] with a great offering of sacrificed animals, lovely fragrances, and other materials. Surely the deities will be pleased with this! Thus, the great sacrifice has been completed for this year.
May there be peace between heaven and earth.
column3: May there be peace between heaven and earth.
column4: May there be peace between heaven and earth.
column6: May there be peace between heaven and earth.

column2: [This.GetTitledFirstName] wants to live a long and fulfilling life.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] currently doesn't have one of the seven virtues, and would like to have one.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] desires to get involved in some sort of hobby.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] desires to fill a void in [This.GetHerHis] life by finding someone to spend [This.GetHerHis] life with.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] wishes to fight against infidels and heathens in the name of [This.GetHerHis] faith!
[This.GetTitledFirstName] wants to be happy again and live a normal life.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] wishes to travel away from home.

A lawspeaker was a unique Scandinavian legal office. It has its basis in a common Germanic oral tradition, where wise men were asked to recite the law, but it was only in Scandinavia that the function evolved into an office.
column3: A lawspeaker was a unique Scandinavian legal office. It has its basis in a common Germanic oral tradition, where wise men were asked to recite the law, but it was only in Scandinavia that the function evolved into an office.
column4: A lawspeaker was a unique Scandinavian legal office. It has its basis in a common Germanic oral tradition, where wise men were asked to recite the law, but it was only in Scandinavia that the function evolved into an office.
column6: A lawspeaker was a unique Scandinavian legal office. It has its basis in a common Germanic oral tradition, where wise men were asked to recite the law, but it was only in Scandinavia that the function evolved into an office.

column2: The Lique Mekwas was an impersonator or double of the Emperor, who accompanied him in battle. Two trusted and highly favored officials were given this title. They always walked or rode on either side of the monarch in battle, or in public processions, dressing as magnificently, or more magnificently then he, in order to distract assassins.
column3: The Lique Mekwas was an impersonator or double of the Emperor, who accompanied him in battle. Two trusted and highly favored officials were given this title. They always walked or rode on either side of the monarch in battle, or in public processions, dressing as magnificently, or more magnificently then he, in order to distract assassins.

column2: In the Malian Empire, the Belen-Tigui, or master of ceremonies, was an important office within the Gbara, an assembly of nobles and important figures that at times had authority equal to that of the king.
column3: In the Malian Empire, the Belen-Tigui, or master of ceremonies, was an important office within the Gbara, an assembly of nobles and important figures that at times had authority equal to that of the king.
column4: In the Malian Empire, the Belen-Tigui, or master of ceremonies, was an important office within the Gbara, an assembly of nobles and important figures that at times had authority equal to that of the king.
column6: In the Malian Empire, the Belen-Tigui, or master of ceremonies, was an important office within the Gbara, an assembly of nobles and important figures that at times had authority equal to that of the king.

column2: A griot is a West African historian, storyteller, praise singer, poet and/or musician and a repository of oral tradition. As such, they are sometimes also called bards. In the Malian empire, there would be entire families of aristocratic griots who would advise and entertain rulers.
column3: A griot is a West African historian, storyteller, praise singer, poet and/or musician and a repository of oral tradition. As such, they are sometimes also called bards. In the Malian empire, there would be entire families of aristocratic griots who would advise and entertain rulers.
column4: A griot is a West African historian, storyteller, praise singer, poet and/or musician and a repository of oral tradition. As such, they are sometimes also called bards. In the Malian empire, there would be entire families of aristocratic griots who would advise and entertain rulers.

column2: The Kanikleios was the keeper of the imperial inkstand, one of the senior officials of the imperial chancery. In the Komnenian and Palaiologan period, the office was often given to trusted aides by the emperors, who functioned as effective chief ministers.
column3: The Kanikleios was the keeper of the imperial inkstand, one of the senior officials of the imperial chancery. In the Komnenian and Palaiologan period, the office was often given to trusted aides by the emperors, who functioned as effective chief ministers.
column4: The Kanikleios was the keeper of the imperial inkstand, one of the senior officials of the imperial chancery. In the Komnenian and Palaiologan period, the office was often given to trusted aides by the emperors, who functioned as effective chief ministers.
column6: The Kanikleios was the keeper of the imperial inkstand, one of the senior officials of the imperial chancery. In the Komnenian and Palaiologan period, the office was often given to trusted aides by the emperors, who functioned as effective chief ministers.

column2: Protospatharios was originally the title borne by the leader of the spatharioi ("swordbearers," the Emperor's bodyguards). Later on, it became one of the highest court dignities of the Byzantine Empire, awarded to senior generals and provincial governors, as well as to foreign princes.
column3: Protospatharios was originally the title borne by the leader of the spatharioi ("swordbearers," the Emperor's bodyguards). Later on, it became one of the highest court dignities of the Byzantine Empire, awarded to senior generals and provincial governors, as well as to foreign princes.
column4: Protospatharios was originally the title borne by the leader of the spatharioi ("swordbearers," the Emperor's bodyguards). Later on, it became one of the highest court dignities of the Byzantine Empire, awarded to senior generals and provincial governors, as well as to foreign princes.

column2: Nagid is a Hebrew term meaning a prince or leader. This title was often applied to the religious leader in Sephardic communities of the Middle Ages, generally in Egypt.
A Marcher Lord was a strong and trusted noble appointed by the King of England to guard the border (known as the Welsh Marches) between England and Wales.
I’m coming out into this world!

After giving birth to my child, you feel as if my energy is being drained, perhaps too much. Everything is getting dark now, and even the voices of people screaming around you are fading away into nothingness. In a short while, you will begin your journey into the afterlife...
Oh [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], at least let my child live!
May [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] have mercy on my soul.
My children will also learn the local customs and language, just as I have.
Members seek to institute succession by Tanistry in [This.GetName]. When sufficiently powerful, §Y[From.GetBestName]§! may present an ultimatum to §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§!.
column3: Members seek to institute succession by Tanistry in [This.GetName]. When sufficiently powerful, §Y[From.GetBestName]§! may present an ultimatum to §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§!.
column4: Members seek to institute succession by Tanistry in [This.GetName]. When sufficiently powerful, §Y[From.GetBestName]§! may present an ultimatum to §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§!.
column6: Members seek to institute succession by Tanistry in [This.GetName]. When sufficiently powerful, §Y[From.GetBestName]§! may present an ultimatum to §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§!.

column2: Members seek to institute succession by Ultimogeniture in [This.GetName]. When sufficiently powerful, §Y[From.GetBestName]§! may present an ultimatum to §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§!.
column3: Les membres d'une faction cherchent à établir la succession par ultimogéniture à [This.GetName]. Une fois son soutien assuré, §Y[From.GetBestName]§! pourra lancer un ultimatum à §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§!.
column4: Mitglieder streben die Einführung einer Nachfolge nach Ultimogenitur in [This.GetName] an. Sobald §Y[From.GetBestName]§! mächtig genug ist, könnte §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§! ein Ultimatum gestellt werden.
column6: Pretenden instaurar la sucesión por Ultimogenitura en [This.GetName]. Cuando sean suficientemente poderosos, §Y[From.GetBestName]§! podrá enviar un ultimátum a §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§!.

column3: Loi de Succession pour la Ultimogéniture

column2: §Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to change the succession law in the §Y$TITLE$§! to tanistry!
column3: §Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to change the succession law in the §Y$TITLE$§! to tanistry!
column4: §Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to change the succession law in the §Y$TITLE$§! to tanistry!
column6: §Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to change the succession law in the §Y$TITLE$§! to tanistry!

column2: §Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to change the succession law in the §Y$TITLE$§! to ultimogeniture!
column3: Le(la) §Y$CLAIMANT$§! peut déclarer la guerre pour imposer une loi de succession basée sur la ultimogéniture du §Y$TITLE$§!
column4: §Y$CLAIMANT$§! kann einen Krieg erklären, um das Nachfolgerecht für den Titel §Y$TITLE$§! auf Jüngestenrecht zu ändern.
column6: ¡§Y$CLAIMANT$§! puede declarar la guerra para basar la ley de sucesión del §Y$TITLE$§! en la ultimogenitura!

column2: Present an ultimatum to §Y[Root.Liege.GetBestName]§!, demanding succession by Tanistry. If [Root.Liege.GetSubjectPronoun] refuses to comply, your Faction will rise in revolt.
Present an ultimatum to §Y[Root.Liege.GetBestName]§!, demanding succession by Ultimogeniture. If [Root.Liege.GetSubjectPronoun] refuses to comply, your Faction will rise in revolt.
column3: Présentez un ultimatum à §Y[Root.Liege.GetBestName]§! pour exiger la succession par ultimogéniture. Si [Root.Liege.GetSubjectPronoun] refuse votre requête, votre faction prendra alors les armes.
column4: Stellt §Y[Root.Liege.GetBestName]§! ein Ultimatum und fordert die Nachfolge nach Ultimogenitur. Sollte [Root.Liege.GetSubjectPronoun] dies ablehnen, wird Eure Fraktion einen Aufstand anzetteln.
column6: Enviar un ultimátum a §Y[Root.Liege.GetBestName]§!, reclamando la sucesión por Ultimogenitura. Si [Root.Liege.GetSubjectPronoun] se niega a concederla, tu Facción se sublevará.

column2: You’re a small child - the world around you is so new and so dangerous! Many children don’t live to see adulthood, but perhaps you’ll be luckier.

You’ve survived the crucial first few years of life, outliving many other unfortunate children who died due to their frail health. Of course, this only means your life has begun - many new surprises and dangers await.
The [Root.Religion.GetName] faith has done much this year in the name of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
I'm not supposed to be Jewish - my parents certainly aren't!
I'll convert back to my parents religion immediately.
I desire for a child to carry on my name and legacy, that my great dynasty will survive until the end of days!
My efforts to make a child have been fulfilled.
Thank the heavens my wish was fulfilled.

During the Mongol world conquests, Genghis Khan named four of his top generals as so-called "Dogs of War" - Subotai, Jebe, Jelme, and Khubilai. They were considered his most trusted and most capable military commanders, and they played key roles in several of Genghis Khan's campaigns. The title probably came about because Mongols had a lot of dogs, and dogs were very useful for people's lives in hunting and warnings.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] wants to practice honesty, a virtue highly revered by Zoroastrians.

The office of Amir al-Umara was originally a title (also referred to as "emir of emirs," "chief emir," and "commander of commanders) used in the Abbasid Caliphate and various Muslim realms to senior military leaders. The Norman monarchs of Sicily, influenced by Sicily's Arabic past, continued using various Arabic terms in their administration, including the "Amir al-Umara." The holders of this title had both civilian and military authority.
My spouse is Jewish. This is not good for my reputation at all!
[Root.Spouse.GetSheHeCap] must be converted to the true faith!
[Root.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] is "persuaded" to convert to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.
My spouse is demanding that I abandon my Jewish ways and convert to the [From.Religion.GetName] faith.
Oy vey! What choice do I have?
I will not abandon the Jewish people! I live and die a Jew!
My child is Jewish. This is not good for my reputation at all!
The child must be converted to the true faith!
[Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s child is "persuaded" to convert to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.
My parent is demanding that I abandon my Jewish ways and convert to the [From.Religion.GetName] faith.
Oy vey! What choice do I have?
I will not abandon the Jewish people! I live and die a Jew!

This is where the elite infantry serving a Jewish ruler is trained. Special care is taken to equip the soldiers with the finest heavy armor that money can buy. This, combined with rigorous training and iron discipline, makes them an elite force to be truly feared.
column3: C’est là que l’infanterie d’élite au service d’un seigneur juif s’entraîne. Une attention spéciale est donnée pour équiper les soldats avec les meilleures armures lourdes qui puissent être achetées. Cela, combiné avec l’entraînement rigoureux et une discipline de fer, font de ces soldats une terrifiante force d’élite.
column6: Aquí es donde se entrena la infantería de élite que sirve a los señores judios. Se pone especial atención en equipar a los soldados con la mejor armadura que el dinero pueda comprar. Combinado esto con el entrenamiento riguroso y la disciplina férrea, hacen que estas fuerzas de élite sean realmente temidas.

column2: Mighty warriors dwell here, trained in the traditional martial arts of their people.
The great [Root.GetTitledName] and all [Root.GetHerHis] vassals have converted and embraced the Hindu faith!
Strange... they change from worshipping one set of idols for another?
The great [Root.GetTitledName] and all [Root.GetHerHis] vassals have converted and embraced the Buddhist faith!
We shall protect the Buddha's message of compassion and wisdom!
Good, the Buddhist faith, though peaceful, needs a strong protector!
At least the Buddhists tend towards pacifism... right?
The great [Root.GetTitledName] and all [Root.GetHerHis] vassals have converted and embraced the Jewish faith!
Truly, Yahweh favors us! Our enemies shall tremble.
Better that than pagan, I guess...
The great [Root.GetTitledName] and all [Root.GetHerHis] vassals have converted and embraced the Zoroastrian faith!
The holy fires shall never die out with us protecting them.
Oh my... will they avenge their Persian brothers by attacking good Muslims?

If you see this event this means you gave your character some of the age customizer traits in ruler designer. This event will remove these "invisible" traits to make the character interface screen look cleaner, and to ensure that the game no longer keeps track of these traits.
The great [Root.GetTitledName] and all [Root.GetHerHis] vassals have converted and embraced the Ibadi faith!
The great [Root.GetTitledName] and all [Root.GetHerHis] vassals have converted and embraced the Yazidi faith!
The great [Root.GetTitledName] and all [Root.GetHerHis] vassals have converted and embraced the Manichean faith!
We are now children of the Light.
May the light conquer and banish the darkness!

You have to meet these requirements to declare holy war on pagans. You also need to meet the base requirements (displayed on the war declaration screen if you fulfill the requirements listed on the decision screen), and potentially non-dejure requirements.
This pagan has acquired much fame as a fearsome raider.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] wants to become a notorious pagan raider, a pillager and looter known from Ireland to Constantinople, feared by friend and foe alike.

The pillaging and looting undertaken in your name has earned you a reputation as a fearsome pagan raider. From Ireland to Constantinople, people fear the name of [Root.GetFirstName], the ruthless plunderer and merciless raider!
Slight reduction in garrison size due to a preference for a nomadic lifestyle in the military

In the Great Hunt, or Nerge as it was known to the Mongols, an entire nomad army hunts all wildlife in a vast expanse of wilderness. This not only provides food for the winter, but also improves discipline among the troops.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] wishes to follow [This.GetHerHis] faith's ideal of poverty.
The Possessor of Mint, or "Ebn Na'na," was the Sogdian title of the lord of Bottaman, who was probably a vassal of the Malek of Oshrushanna.

The first Crusade into the Holy Land has succeeded beyond the wildest expectations of the Crusader armies. Godfrey of Bouillon now sits as King of Jerusalem, though he claims that the true King of Jerusalem is Jesus Christ. Though Christians everywhere celebrate this great victory,  they can only rest for so long: the Muslims are licking their wounds, preparing to avenge this embarrassing defeat and reclaim the Holy Land. Meanwhile, Emperor Alexios of Byzantium watches warily - realizing his originally simple plan of using the Western barbarians as a mercenary force against the Turks has had unforeseen consequences, perhaps the Byzantine Empire needs to reevaluate the situation in the Holy Land if they are to reclaim the Legacy of Rome.

Just a few centuries ago, Islam almost conquered all of Iberia. Just a mere half a century ago,  as Christian Iberia was on the brink of defeat, El Cid bravely fought against the Moors. Now, the winds of change are blowing in Iberia. To the south, the decadent Almoravids are collapsing, replaced by an even more zealous dynasty, the Almohads. Portugal has just officially won its independence. Meanwhile, Castille and Aragon continue to resist the Muslims, hoping that one day their dream of the reconquista will be accomplished. Who will succeed in this turbulent region - Almohad or Almoravid, Spanish or Portuguese, Christian or Muslim?

From the East they came, ruthless and without mercy: strange men, dressed in exotic armor and speaking in guttural tongues that none understood. Rumors carried across the Silk Road and the Indian Ocean have told of how Genghis Khan and his invincible Mongol hordes shattered the greatest empires of the known world, from Cathay to Persia. Though Genghis Khan is now dead, the sons and grandsons of Genghis intend to continue his conquests. They have their eyes upon Europe and the rest of the Middle East, and the entire world may be united under the banner of Genghis... if his descendants do not end up fighting among themselves, that is. Perhaps the end of days has finally come at last, a punishment for the sins of the wicked... or perhaps this is God’s greatest test yet for the faithful.

With the breakup of the Sultanate of the Rum and the decline of the Byzantine Empire, several warlords in Anatolia seek ame and glory in the ensuing power vacuum. Foremost among them is Osman, a pious and brave man. According to a dream he had many, many years ago, some say that great things will be in store for Osman and his dynasty, and that they might even conquer great Constantinople one day. But the journey to Constantinople won’t be easy, and the Byzantine Empire, which has resisted attack after attack for almost a thousand years, will not go down without a fight.

For more than two centuries, the Khitan were the rightful rulers of northern China, perfectly balancing their traditional, nomadic way of life, and the urbane, sophisticated culture of their Chinese subjects. However, overthrown by their Jurchen vassals in the early years of the 12th century, remnants of the once-great Khitan have fled to Central Asia, where they seek to re-create their imperial splendor. Having just defeated the once-mighty Kara-Khanids and the Seljuks, the Khitan now have a foothold in the region. Will they continue their conquests, spreading their Sinicized nomadic culture and their Buddhist faith, or will they settle down, content with re-creating their Chinese empire in Central Asia? All that is certain, however, is that the Khitan are not the first horde to appear suddenly from the far east, nor will they be the last.
column3: For more than two centuries, the Khitan were the rightful rulers of northern China, perfectly balancing their traditional, nomadic way of life, and the urbane, sophisticated culture of their Chinese subjects. However, overthrown by their Jurchen vassals in the early years of the 12th century, remnants of the once-great Khitan have fled to Central Asia, where they seek to re-create their imperial splendor. Having just defeated the once-mighty Kara-Khanids and the Seljuks, the Khitannow have a foothold in the region. Will they continue their conquests, spreading their Sinicized nomadic culture and their Buddhist faith, or will they settle down, content with re-creating their Chinese empire in Central Asia? All that is certain, however, is that the Khitan are not the first horde to appear suddenly from the far east, nor will they be the last.

All that is certain, however, is that the Khitan are not the first horde to appear suddenly from the far east, nor will they be the last.

column2: West Africa is flourishing, despite the fall of the Empire of Ghana a century or two ago. Now a great leader has arisen among the Manden peoples: Sundiata Keita, the lion of Songolon. The Griots have already said much about this great king - some even claim he is a descendant of Bilal, companion to Prophet Mohammed and the first to call Muslims to prayer. Will the Lion King and his descendants unite the savanna into a great empire, harness the potential of its abundant gold, and make it the envy of the world?

§Y'How the little piglets would grunt if they knew how the old boar suffered.'§! Those were the prophetic last words of the legendary viking §YRagnarr Loðbrok§! as he lay dying in the snake pit of Northumbrian king §YÆlla§!. In 867 the vengeful sons of Loðbrok and their 'Great Heathen Army' descended upon the petty kingdoms of Britain to make of §YÆlla§! a 'Blood Eagle'. Meanwhile, two other Norse lords - §YRurik§! and §YDyre§! - were carving out their own rival states among the Slavic and Finnish tribes of the East, laying down the foundations for what would one day become Russia. Meanwhile, to the east, the onslaught of Islam continues against the old faiths of the Silk Road - §YZoroastrian, Buddhism, Manichaeism, Hinduism§! - but the loyal followers of these remnants are stubbornly defiant in the face of near-certain doom. The Old Gods are still strong and their warriors mighty!
column3: §YÔ combien les petits porcelets ronchonneraient s'ils savaient à quel point a souffert le vieux sanglier.§! Voilà qui furent les dernières paroles prophétiques du légendaire Viking §YRagnarr Loðbrok§! alors qu'il gisait à l'agonie dans la fosse aux serpents de §YÆlla§!, le roi northumbrien. En 867, les fils vindicatifs de Loðbrok et leur 'Grande Armée païenne' ont pénétré dans les petits royaumes de Bretagne et ont fait de §YÆlla§! un 'aigle de sang'. Au même moment, deux autres seigneurs nordiques, §YRurik§! et §YDyre§!, souillaient les terres de leurs rivaux parmi les tribus slaves et finnoises dans l'Est, posant les fondations de ce qui allait un jour devenir la Russie. Les Anciens Dieux sont toujours puissants, tout comme le sont leurs puissants guerriers !
column4: §YWie die kleinen Ferkel grunzen würden, wenn sie wüssten, wie das alte Wildschwein litt.§! Dies waren die prophetischen letzten Worte des legendären Wikingers §YRagnarr Loðbrok§!, als er sterbend in der Schlangengrube des northumbrischen Königs §YÆlla§! lag. 867 fielen die rachedurstigen Söhne von Loðbrok mit ihrer 'Großen Ketzerischen Armee' in die erbärmlichen Königreiche Brittaniens ein, um §YÆlla§! zum 'Blutadler' zu machen. Zu gleicher Zeit erschufen zwei andere nordische Lords - §YRurik§! und §YDyre§! - ihre eigenen rivalisierenden Staaten unter den slawischen und finnischen Stämmen des Ostens und legten den Grundstein für das, was eines Tages Russland sein würde. Die Alten Götter sind noch immer mächtig und ihre Krieger sind stark!
column6: §YCómo gruñirían los cerditos si supieran cómo sufrió el viejo jabalí.§! Esas fueron las últimas palabras proféticas del legendario vikingo §YRagnarr Loðbrok§! mientras agonizaba en el nido de vívoras del rey de Northumbria §YÆlla§!. En el 867, los vengativos hijos de Loðbrok y su ‘Gran Ejército Pagano’ descendieron sobre los pequeños reinos de Bretaña para hacer de §YÆlla§! un ‘Águila de Sangre’. Mientras tanto, otros dos señores Nórdicos, §YRurik§! y §YDyre§!, fueron forjando sus propios estados rivales entre las tribus Eslavas y Finlandesas del Este, estableciendo las bases de lo que un día se convertiría en Rusia. ¡Los Antiguos Dioses aún son fuertes y sus guerreros poderosos!

column2: Several Hindu Indian merchants who have been operating in our region for several years have decided to settle down. They are now offering their services, wishing to assist us using their expertise in various matters.
I have found a nice Indian girl to marry. She'll remind me of my homeland back in India.
One of your Hindu courtiers is getting married, having found a good girl from his homeland in India.
I wish the couple the best.

Several Swahili merchants who have been operating in our region for several years have decided to settle down. They are now offering their services, wishing to assist us using their expertise in various matters.
I am about to marry to a nice Swahili girl from my hometown.
One of your Swahili courtiers is getting married.
